The first evidence of the worship of Osiris was found in the middle of the Fifth dynasty of Egypt, although The first evidence of the worship of Osiris is likely that he was worshiped much earlier; the Khenti-Amentiu epithet dates to at least the first dynasty, and was also used as a pharaonic title.
-----------------------

Stage 1:
['Most', 'information', 'available', 'on', 'the', 'myths', 'of', 'Osiris', 'is', 'derived', 'from', 'allusions', 'contained', 'in', 'the', 'Pyramid', 'Texts', 'at', 'the', 'end', 'of', 'the', 'Fifth', 'Dynasty', ',', 'later', 'New', 'Kingdom', 'source', 'documents', 'such', 'as', 'the', 'Shabaka', 'Stone', 'and', 'the', 'Contending', 'of', 'Horus', 'and', 'Seth', ',', 'and', 'much', 'later', ',', 'in', 'narrative', 'style', 'from', 'the', 'writings', 'of', 'Greek', 'authors', 'including', 'Plutarch', 'and', 'Diodorus', 'Siculus', '.']
Most information available on the myths of Osiris is derived from allusions contained in the Pyramid Texts at the end of the Fifth Dynasty, later New Kingdom source documents such as the Shabaka Stone and the Contending of Horus and Seth, and much later, in narrative style from the writings of Greek authors including Plutarch and Diodorus Siculus.
-----------------------

Stage 1:
['Osiris', 'was', 'considered', 'not', 'only', 'a', 'merciful', 'judge', 'of', 'the', 'dead', 'in', 'the', 'afterlife', ',', 'but', 'also', 'the', 'underworld', 'agency', 'that', 'granted', 'all', 'life', ',', 'including', 'sprouting', 'vegetation', 'and', 'the', 'fertile', 'flooding', 'of', 'the', 'Nile', 'River', '.']
Osiris was considered not only a merciful judge of the dead in the afterlife, but also the underworld agency that granted all life, including sprouting vegetation and the fertile flooding of the Nile River.

Stage 1:
['The', 'Kings', 'of', 'Egypt', 'were', 'associated', 'with', 'Osiris', 'in', 'death', '--', 'as', 'Osiris', 'rose', 'from', 'the', 'dead', 'so', 'would', 'they', 'in', 'union', 'with', 'him', ',', 'and', 'inherit', 'eternal', 'life', 'through', 'a', 'process', 'of', 'imitative', 'magic', '.']
The Kings of Egypt were associated with Osiris in death -- as Osiris rose from the dead so would they in union with him, and inherit eternal life through a process of imitative magic.
-----------------------

Stage 1:
['The', 'Passion', 'Plays', 'were', 'held', 'in', 'the', 'last', 'month', 'of', 'the', 'inundation', '-LRB-', 'the', 'annual', 'Nile', 'flood', '-RRB-', ',', 'coinciding', 'with', 'Spring', ',', 'and', 'held', 'at', 'Abydos/Abedjou', 'which', 'was', 'the', 'traditional', 'place', 'where', 'the', 'body', 'of', 'Osiris/Wesir', 'drifted', 'ashore', 'after', 'having', 'been', 'drowned', 'in', 'the', 'Nile', '.']
The Passion Plays were held in the last month of the inundation -LRB- the annual Nile flood -RRB-, coinciding with Spring, and held at Abydos/Abedjou which was the traditional place where the body of Osiris/Wesir drifted ashore after having been drowned in the Nile.
-----------------------

The Passion Plays were held in the last month of the inundation, coinciding with Spring, and held at Abydos/Abedjou which was the traditional place where the body of Osiris/Wesir drifted ashore after having been drowned in the Nile.

['Molds', 'were', 'made', 'from', 'the', 'wood', 'of', 'a', 'red', 'tree', 'in', 'the', 'forms', 'of', 'the', 'sixteen', 'dismembered', 'parts', 'of', 'Osiris', ',', 'the', 'cakes', 'of', '``', 'divine', "''", 'bread', 'were', 'made', 'from', 'each', 'mold', ',', 'placed', 'in', 'a', 'silver', 'chest', 'and', 'set', 'near', 'the', 'head', 'of', 'the', 'god', 'with', 'the', 'inward', 'parts', 'of', 'Osiris', 'as', 'described', 'in', 'the', 'Book', 'of', 'the', 'Dead', '.']
Molds were made from the wood of a red tree in the forms of the sixteen dismembered parts of Osiris, the cakes of "divine" bread were made from each mold, placed in a silver chest and set near the head of the god with the inward parts of Osiris as described in the Book of the Dead.

Stage 1:
['The', 'idea', 'of', 'divine', 'justice', 'being', 'exercised', 'after', 'death', 'for', 'wrongdoing', 'during', 'life', 'is', 'first', 'encountered', 'during', 'the', 'Old', 'Kingdom', 'in', 'a', '6th', 'dynasty', 'tomb', 'containing', 'fragments', 'of', 'what', 'would', 'be', 'described', 'later', 'as', 'the', 'Negative', 'Confessions', '.']
The idea of divine justice being exercised after death for wrongdoing during life is first encountered during the Old Kingdom in a 6th dynasty tomb containing fragments of what would be described later as the Negative Confessions.

Osiris was  at times considered the eldest son  of the     god Geb  ,  though other     sources state Osiris      '  father  is  the     sun-god  Ra  ,  and  the sky     goddess Nut  ,   as  well  as being brother and husband  of     Isis  ,  with Horus being considered Horus      '  posthumously      begotten son  .

Osiris was  at times considered the eldest son  of the         god Geb  ,  though other          sources  state Osiris            '    father  is  the     sun-god  Ra  ,  and the sky     goddess Nut  ,   as  well  as being brother and husband  of         Isis  ,  with Horus being considered Horus      '  posthumously      begotten son  .

The first evidence  of the     worship      of     Osiris was found  in the     middle  of the Fifth dynasty  of     Egypt  ,  although The first evidence  of the     worship      of     Osiris  is likely that  he was worshiped     much      earlier  ;  the Khenti-Amentiu epithet dates  to  at      least the first dynasty  ,  and was also used  as  a      pharaonic title  .

The  first  evidence  of the         worship          of          Osiris was found  in the         middle  of   the    Fifth  dynasty  of          Egypt   ,  although The  first   evidence    of   the         worship          of          Osiris  is   likely    that     he   was worshiped           much            earlier  ;  the Khenti-Amentiu epithet dates    to    at            least    the   first dynasty  ,  and was    also   used    as    a          pharaonic title  . 

None
Potential Answer Phrases:
The first evidence of the worship of Osiris 
in the middle of the Fifth dynasty of Egypt 
that he was worshiped much earlier; the Khenti-Amentiu epithet dates to at least the first dynasty, and was also used as a pharaonic title

Most     information available  on the      myths      of     Osiris  is derived from allusions contained  in the Pyramid Texts  at the     end  of the Fifth Dynasty  ,  later New Kingdom source documents such  as the Shabaka Stone and the     Contending      of     Horus and Seth  ,  and much      later  ,   in narrative     style from the     writings  of Greek     authors including Plutarch and Diodorus     Siculus  .

Most         information available  on    the             myths           of          Osiris  is derived from allusions contained  in the Pyramid  Texts   at the         end    of   the Fifth Dynasty  ,   later  New Kingdom source documents such  as   the   Shabaka  Stone    and     the           Contending          of          Horus  and Seth  ,  and much           later  ,   in narrative         style from   the           writings  of  Greek          authors including Plutarch   and   Diodorus         Siculus  . 

None
Potential Answer Phrases:
Most information available on the myths of Osiris 
from allusions contained in the Pyramid Texts at the end of the Fifth Dynasty, later New Kingdom source documents such as the Shabaka Stone and the Contending of Horus and Seth, and much later, in narrative style from the writings of Greek authors including Plutarch and Diodorus Siculus

Through the     hope  of new     life     after     death  ,  Osiris began  to  be associated with the     cycles observed  in     nature  ,   in particular     vegetation and the  annual flooding  of the     Nile  ,  through Osiris      '  links with the heliacal rising  of Orion     and Sirius  at the     start  of the     new year  .

Through the     hope    of   new       life      after         death  ,  Osiris began  to  be associated with the     cycles observed  in         nature  ,   in particular     vegetation and the annual flooding  of   the       Nile  ,  through Osiris      '  links with the heliacal rising  of Orion         and Sirius  at the     start  of the         new year  .

Osiris  is  a  Latin transliteration  of the Ancient Greek Ὄσιρις IPA  :  -LSB- ó.siː.ris -RSB-  ,   which  in     turn  is  the Greek adaptation  of the original theonym  in the     Egyptian language  .

 NNP   VBZ  DT    JJ          NN        IN  DT    JJ      JJ    NNP   NNP    :    -LRB-     NN    -RRB-    ,     WDT   IN            NN   VBZ   DT    JJ       NN      IN    DT      JJ       NN      IN    DT            JJ       NN     .

Osiris  is  a   Latin  transliteration  of the Ancient  Greek  Ὄσιρις IPA    :    -LSB- ó.siː.ris -RSB-    ,    which  in           turn   is  the  Greek  adaptation  of   the   original theonym    in   the         Egyptian language  . 

None

John Gwyn Griffiths  ,   `` bearing  in mind Erman      's emphasis  on the     fact that the      name must begin with  an -LSB- sic -RSB-  w   ''  ,  proposes  a      derivation     from     wsr with  an original meaning  of  `` The Mighty One  ''  .

John Gwyn Griffiths  ,   `` bearing  in mind  Erman       's emphasis  on   the       fact that the          name must begin with    an   -LSB- sic -RSB-  w   ''  ,  proposes  a      derivation     from         wsr with  an original meaning  of  ``   The   Mighty One  ''  .

Yoshi     Muchiki reexamines Erman          's evidence that the  throne hieroglyph  in   the           word  is  to  be     read      ws and finds  it     unconvincing  ,  suggesting  instead  that the          name should  be    read    ꜣsjr     on     the            basis   of Aramaic    ,    Phoenician  ,  and Old South           Arabian transcriptions  ,  readings    of     the    throne   sign   in  other          words  ,  and comparison   with            ꜣst    .

This     aspect      of     Osiris was referred  to  as Banebdjedet  ,  which  is  grammatically      feminine  ,  literally  `` the      ba  of  the     lord  of the djed  ,  which roughly means The     soul  of the     lord  of the     pillar      of     continuity  .

 IN        NNP     ,   NNP   VBD  VBN    NNS     JJ   IN NNP   IN  DT  NN  CC  NN   IN  DT      NN  ,    IN   NN  ,   WRB    NNP   VBD  VBN      VBN          IN      NNP   ,  VBD    VBN      NNP       POS    NN     ,   IN   WP   NNP       POS   JJ      NN    VBZ        VBN     . 
 |          |      |    |     |    |      |      |    |   |    |   |   |   |   |    |   |       |   |    |    |   |    |      |     |    |        |           |        |    |   |      |        |         |     |      |   |    |     |         |    |       |      |          |      |  
 As     Banebdjed  ,  Osiris was given epithets such  as Lord  of the Sky and Life  of the      Ra  ,  since  Ra  ,   when  Osiris had become identified     with     Atum  ,  was considered Osiris      '  ancestor  ,  from whom Osiris      '  regal authority  is     inherited  .

The crook and flail were originally symbols  of the minor agricultural deity Andjety  ,  and passed  to     Osiris later  .

Diodorus     Siculus gives another     version  of the     myth  in      which Osiris was described  as  an ancient king who       taught the     Egyptians the     arts      of     civilization  ,  including     agriculture  ,  then travelled the     world with Osiris      '  sister Isis  ,  the     satyrs  ,  and the nine muses  ,  before finally returning      to     Egypt  .

Diodorus     Siculus gives another         version  of   the           myth  in        which    Osiris was described    as    an ancient   king  who        taught the         Egyptians the         arts          of         civilization  ,  including         agriculture  ,     then   travelled the         world with Osiris            '     sister   Isis   ,    the            satyrs  ,  and the   nine  muses  ,  before  finally  returning        to            Egypt   .

  NNP     CC  NNS   VBP   VBN   IN   DT        NNS          TO      NNP   VBD   ``    JJ    ,    JJ    ,   CC    JJ     ''  CC  IN   DT   JJ     NN      NN     ,     VBN      IN       CD      NNS    ,   VBD   IN  NNP        VBG       DT       NN   IN  DT     NNP      IN         NN      ,   IN  DT  JJ   NN WDT    NN  VBD   VBN    IN      DT       NN    .

Plutarch and others have noted that the     sacrifices      to     Osiris were  ``  gloomy  ,  solemn  ,  and mournful  '' and that the great mystery festival  ,  celebrated  in      two     phases  ,  began  at Abydos commemorating the     death  of the     God      of     Transition  ,   on the same day that grain was planted  in     the     ground  .

Plutarch and  others have noted that the         sacrifices          to          Osiris were  ``    gloomy   ,    solemn   ,  and  mournful  '' and that the  great  mystery festival    ,    celebrated  in            two             phases   ,  began  at  Abydos commemorating   the           death    of     the             God            of         Transition    ,     on   the     same    day   that  grain  was planted    in             the           ground  . 

None
Potential Answer Phrases:

The first phase  of the great mystery festival was  a  public drama depicting the murder and dismemberment  of Osiris  ,  the     search  of Osiris      '  body  by     Isis  ,  Osiris      '  triumphal return  as the     resurrected god  ,  and the     battle  in      which Horus defeated     Set  .

Much  of the  extant information about the     Passion      of         Osiris can  be found  on the     Ikhernofret Stela  at     Abydos erected  in  the 12th Dynasty  by         Ikhernofret  ,  possibly  a      priest      of         Osiris  or other     official during the      reign   of Senwosret     III  .

The Passion Plays were held  in the last month  of the     inundation  ,  coinciding with Spring  ,  and held  at Abydos/Abedjou which was  the traditional place where  the     body      of     Osiris/Wesir drifted ashore after having been drowned  in     the     Nile  .

The Passion Plays were held  in the   last  month  of the         inundation    ,    coinciding   with  Spring  ,  and held  at Abydos/Abedjou  which  was  the traditional place  where  the            body            of         Osiris/Wesir drifted   ashore  after  having been drowned    in             the           Nile  . 

None

 NNS  VBD  VBN   IN   DT      NN   IN  DT      JJ  NN   IN  DT      NNS   IN  DT         CD       VBD      NNS       IN      NNP    ,   DT      NNS   IN  ``   JJ    ''   NN  VBD  VBN   IN       DT       NN   ,   VBN    IN  DT       NN     NN   CC VBN  IN   DT      NN   IN  DT      NN  IN   DT   JJ    NNS   IN      NNP    IN    VBN     IN  DT      NN   IN  DT     NNP   . 
  |    |    |    |    |       |    |   |       |   |    |   |        |    |   |          |         |        |        |        |     |   |        |    |   |    |     |    |    |    |    |        |        |    |    |     |   |        |      |    |   |   |    |       |    |   |       |   |    |    |      |    |        |     |      |      |   |       |    |   |       |    |  
Molds were made from the     wood  of  a      red tree  in the     forms  of the      sixteen dismembered parts      of     Osiris  ,  the     cakes  of  `` divine  '' bread were made from     each     mold  ,  placed  in  a      silver chest and set near the     head  of the     god with the inward parts  of     Osiris  as described  in the     Book  of the     Dead  .

Molds were  made  from the     wood  of  a          red tree  in the         forms    of      the            sixteen dismembered  parts         of            Osiris  ,  the     cakes  of    ``   divine  '' bread were made from     each     mold  ,  placed  in  a      silver chest and set near the     head  of   the       god with the inward parts  of         Osiris  as described  in the           Book     of     the           Dead  .

The     idea  of divine     justice being exercised after death     for     wrongdoing during     life  is first encountered during the     Old  Kingdom  in  a  6th dynasty tomb containing fragments  of what would  be described later  as the     Negative Confessions  .

The     idea  of divine     justice being exercised after death         for         wrongdoing during         life  is first encountered during the     Old Kingdom  in  a  6th dynasty tomb containing fragments  of   what  would  be described later  as the         Negative Confessions  .

Osiris 
an Egyptian god, identified as the god of the afterlife, the underworld, and the dead, but more appropriately as the god of transition, resurrection
